title: Dental Receptionist
description:
We need someone who presents well, is open to new ideas, is a constant learner, and is looking to build a ***long term relationship*** with our practice.

***We offer on the job training*** to help make this happen!

***We need YOU to grow with us!***

*Our location is within 5 minutes of Northvale NJ, located in Tappan NY!*

We're searching for a ***motivated*** new team member looking for bigger opportunities and greater impact on patient lives! She must be ***flexible*** and open to working as both a front desk receptionist and clinical assistant. ***We offer on the job training*** to help make this happen! If you have no experience but have the right ***attitude, ambition, and dicipline,*** we can train you to be the best in the field! ***We expect only the best!***

We need someone who presents well, is open to new ideas, is a constant learner, and is looking to build a ***long term relationship*** with our practice. It's important that a new team member is prepared to commit **two years or more** to the dental field. This Full-Time position comes with a competitive hourly income and ***great bonus opportunities***.

We are a high quality, high integrity office that's focused on providing our patients with a 5 Star Experience! All of our doctors and team are ***family focused and patient oriented***, and for 25 years we've practiced in Bergenfield NJ and have now opened our brand new office in Tappan NY. Our goal is to provide quality and trust to all of our patients. Our expanding team is constantly seeing new patients and growing as a result. ***We need YOU to grow with us!***

We use cutting edge technology: Itero Scanners, Digital X-Ray Systems, Dexis and Dentrix programs, paperless, Cone-Beam 3D X-Rays, Cephelographs, Invisalign, etc.

Our office performs all forms of treatment including: Implants, Root Canals, general dentistry, pediatric dentistry, sedation, orthodontics, etc.

***If this sounds like something for you, please submit your resume with email and expect a quick reply!***

To allow us to get to know you a bit better, I will need a little more than your resume. Please send us a letter telling us a little about yourself. Here is the information that must be contained within your letter:

* Explain why this position specifically appeals to you.
* Explain what you feel your special qualifications are. Be specific about your talents, experience, or skills that make you uniquely qualified. Tell me what sets you apart from all the other qualified candidates.
* Please include your salary history
* Include all your contact information and when is the best time to reach you if you are selected for an interview. Please be specific.

I will personally review your letter and resume and, if you are the type of individual we are looking for, I will call you for a phone interview.

***Thank you for taking the time to read this post, and I wish you the best in your career search.***

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Paid time off

* Vision insurance

title: Live In Housekeeper/Babysitter - Ama de Llaves/Ninera - Interna
description:
**A lovely family in Englewood, NJ is seeking a Live In Housekeeper/Babysitter to support their family. The family consists of Mom, who is not working, Dad, and three children, ages 11, 9 and 3. In this position, your time will be spent approximately 60% on housekeeping and 40% on helping with the children before school and through the afterschool to bedtime routine.**

**Una familia encantadora en Englewood, NJ, busca una niñera o ama de llaves que viva en el hogar para ayudar a su familia. La familia está compuesta por la mamá, que no trabaja, el papá y tres niños de 11, 9 y 3 años. En este puesto, dedicará aproximadamente el 60 % de su tiempo a las tareas del hogar y el 40 % a ayudar con los niños antes de la escuela y durante la rutina después de la escuela hasta la hora de dormir.**

**Location**: Englewood, NJ

**Schedule:** Monday - Friday

**Salary**: $800 - $850/week to start

Benefits: Paid vacation, paid holidays and paid time off. Private room and bathroom with all food, internet and utilities included

**Responsibilities:**

- Clean, maintain and organize the family home

- Assist Mom and Dad with getting the children prepared for school in the morning, when Mom and Dad needs an extra set of hands

- Assist Mom and Dad with caring for the chidlren after school and through the nightly dinner and bedtime routine for the youngest child, when they need an extra set of hands.

**Requirements:**

- Mom speaks Spanish fluently, so fluent English language skills are not required

-1+ year of residential cleaning experience

- Childcare experience preferred

- References must be provided

If you think you might be the right person for this position, please apply!

**Ubicación:** Englewood, NJ

**Horario:** de lunes a viernes

**Salario:** $800 - $850/semana para comenzar

**Beneficios:** Vacaciones pagas, feriados pagos y tiempo libre pago. Habitación y baño privados con toda la comida, internet y servicios incluidos

**Responsabilidades:**

- Limpiar, mantener y organizar la casa familiar

- Ayudar a mamá y papá a preparar a los niños para la escuela por la mañana, cuando mamá y papá necesitan un par de manos extra

- Ayudar a mamá y papá con el cuidado de los niños después de la escuela y durante la cena y la rutina de la hora de dormir para el niño más pequeño, cuando necesitan un par de manos extra.

**Requisitos:**

- La mamá habla español con fluidez, por lo que no se requieren habilidades fluidas en el idioma inglés

- 1+ año de experiencia en limpieza residencial

- Se prefiere experiencia en cuidado de niños

- Se deben proporcionar referencias

Si cree que podría ser la persona adecuada para este puesto, ¡presente su solicitud!

title: 2025 Summer Intern – Corporate Banking (New York, NY)
description:
**Description**

**Start Date:** May 2025



Commercial Summer Internship Program



The Commercial Summer Internship Program is designed to give interns a look at Citizens Bank’s culture and exposure into one of the many commercial banking business lines through project-based assignments, learning curriculum, networking, volunteer opportunities and formal mentorship. Responsibilities will vary based on the group you’re assigned to and will leverage your unique skills and abilities. At the conclusion of the program, high performers will get early consideration into the Commercial Banker Development Program (CBDP), a 1-year rotational training and development program and start to your career in Commercial Banking.


**The Corporate Banking New York Team** helps corporations and sponsor-owned entities execute on valuable business opportunities and strategies in our geographic footprint and nationally within our specialty businesses. Delivery and execution across the full spectrum of wholesale banking products and services, including capital markets, advisory, treasury management, currency, and interest rate risk management.



Job Responsibilities


* The summer intern will support Corporate Banking and in turn, senior bankers, and the coverage support team.
* Work closely with Commercial Excellence team on Sales Force and CRM user experience improvements.
* Shadow deal teams to gain an understanding how and what we deliver for our clients.
* Work closely with the coverage support team on live deals, industry and company analysis, modeling, and pitch books/marketing materials.
* You will be work closely with a coverage team member who will be a resource throughout the summer to answer questions, guide you through challenging situations or tasks, and provide real-time feedback.
* Participate in Team Meetings, Capital Markets calls and broader Commercial Banking calls.
* Network within the commercial bank and ask questions about specific roles.
* Complete other tasks and special projects as required.


Qualifications:


* Successfully complete a video interview assessment within 7 days of receiving the link. If not completed within the timeframe, your application will be automatically withdrawn from consideration.
* Current students enrolled in an undergraduate bachelor’s program, graduating between Winter 2025 – Spring 2026 **OR** current students enrolled in a graduate program, graduating between Winter 2025 – Spring 2026
* Minimum GPA of 3.2; Preferred cumulative GPA of 3.5.
	+ Please include your cumulative GPA on your resume.
* Relevant work experience, leadership experience or coursework in Finance, Accounting or Economics is preferred but all majors will be considered.
* Strong analytical skills and software skills: MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) proficiency is required.
* Candidates must currently be a U.S. Resident to be eligible for this program.
	+ Please note that U.S. Immigration sponsorship or work visa is not available for intern / full time Analyst positions and candidates must have permanent authorization to work in the U.S

This position offers $30/hr as a starting rate.



Since this a temporary position, you are not eligible to participate in the Citizens colleague benefits program. Accordingly, you will not be eligible to participate in the Citizens health and welfare plans, savings and investment plans, or discretionary award plans or any other Citizens benefit plans or programs, except as otherwise required by law.


**Hours & Work Schedule**


* Hours per Week: 40
* Work Schedule: M-F


*Some job boards have started using jobseeker-reported data to estimate salary ranges for roles. If you apply and qualify for this role, a recruiter will discuss accurate pay guidance.*


**Equal Employment Opportunity**


At Citizens we value diversity, equity and inclusion, and treat everyone with respect and professionalism. Employment decisions are based solely on experience, performance, and ability. Citizens, its parent, subsidiaries, and related companies (Citizens) provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, citizenship, physical or mental disability, perceived disability or history or record of a disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression (including transgender individuals who are transitioning, have transitioned, or are perceived to be transitioning to the gender with which they identify), genetic information, genetic characteristic, marital or domestic partner status, victim of domestic violence, family status/parenthood, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, pregnancy/childbirth/lactation, colleague’s or a dependent’s reproductive health decision making, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.


Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer


Citizens is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective affiliates.

**Why Work for Us**
At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth
*Background Check*


*Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the candidate successfully passing a background check, which may include initial credit, motor vehicle record, public record, prior employment verification, and criminal background checks. Results of the background check are individually reviewed based upon legal requirements imposed by our regulators and with consideration of the nature and gravity of the background history and the job offered. Any offer of employment will include further information.*
company_description: Citizens is where you’ll have the support and training to make an impact and take your career wherever you want to go. Join us today.

title: Busser
description:
Job Summary:

We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Busser to join our restaurant team. As a Busser, you will be responsible for ensuring the cleanliness and efficiency of the dining area, helping to create an exceptional experience for our customers. This role is a vital part of our hospitality team, requiring excellent communication skills and a passion for delivering outstanding customer service.

Responsibilities:

- Clean and maintain the dining area, including tables, chairs, floors, and restrooms.  
- Help servers and bartenders with food and beverage service, including clearing tables, delivering condiments, and taking orders.  
- Assist with food handling and preparation  
- Maintain a clean and organized kitchen, adhering to all food safety and handling standards.  
- Provide exceptional customer service, responding to customer inquiries and resolving any issues that may arise.  
- Help to create a welcoming atmosphere in the restaurant, ensuring all customers feel comfortable and well cared for.  
- Support the restaurant team with tasks such as setting up events, helping with food delivery, and assisting with inventory management.  
- Communicate effectively with the kitchen and service staff to ensure seamless service.

Qualifications:

- Previous experience in the food industry, preferably in a restaurant or kitchen environment.  
- Knowledge of food handling and service procedures.  
- Excellent communication skills, with the ability to interact with customers and staff in a professional and friendly manner.  
- Ability to work well under pressure, prioritizing tasks and maintaining a calm and efficient demeanor.  
- Physical stamina to lift heavy objects and stand for extended periods.  
- A passion for providing exceptional customer service and a commitment to maintaining a clean and welcoming environment.  
- Familiarity with the hospitality industry and its standards.  
- A strong attention to detail and a willingness to learn and grow with the restaurant team.

title: Dental Assistant
description:
We are a thriving pediatric dental practice in the Montclair area and are looking to add to our team. We are looking for a experienced, friendly, enthusiastic dental assistant to join our team. The right person is eager to learn and has a problem solver mindset.

Responsibilities:  
- Assist the dentist during dental procedures  
- Prepare and sterilize dental instruments and equipment  
- Take and develop dental x-rays  
- Provide patient education on oral hygiene and post-operative care

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date patient records, including medical history and treatment plans  
- Provide chairside assistance to the dentist during procedures, including passing instruments, suctioning, and providing patient comfort  
- Perform patient assessments, including taking vital signs and recording medical history

Experience:  
- Previous experience as a Dental Assistant required.  
- Familiarity with pediatric dentistry is a plus  
- Knowledge of medical coding and documentation practices

We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages for our employees. Join our team of dedicated dental professionals and make a difference in patients' lives every day.

title: Catering Sales Manager
company: TKP Bar & Grill, Crowne Plaza Newark
description:
**Summary:**

The Catering Manager must have a passion for outside sales and actively soliciting new business.

**Catering Manager** **Essential Duties and Responsibilities** include the following:

* Other duties may be assigned.
* Identifies, solicits and develops new business through obtaining accounts from reader board service, direct sales from existing accounts and contact new customers in the market.
* Solicitation of new and of existing business should be through a combination of outside sales calls, appointments, telemarketing, social media, site tours, constant prospecting and networking.
* The Catering Manager solicits and responds to sales inquiries from potential clients and customers seeking sleeping rooms, meeting space, food and beverage services, etc.
* Serves as primary contact for meeting and banquet functions to ensure all preparations have been made as detailed on Banquet Event Orders (BEO), last minute needs and changes are responded to expediently.
* Attends and facilitates weekly BEO meetings with Food and Beverage staff.
* The Catering Manager handles all details of definite groups including menu planning, AV requirements, process Banquet Event Orders, and obtain guarantees, distribution of group resumes, VIP’s, rooming lists and billing.
* Participates in industry events, trade shows and promotional events with the target market.
* Maintains relationships with assigned accounts through regular sales calls, client entertainment, site inspections and consistent follow up. (Using traces in Delphi)
* Understands the competitive landscape and do what it takes to secure business that meets or exceeds revenue expectations and profit goals.
* Responsible for and implementation a sales action plan for the development of market segment which includes room blocks, telephone/direct mail solicitation, trade show participation and property tours.
* The Catering Manager meets or exceeds established monthly, quarterly, annual targeted revenue and monthly solicitation goals.
* Attends weekly staff meeting to review group resumes.
* Communicates all pertinent information on upcoming group needs, VIP clients, meeting functions to hotel department staff.
* Reconciles group bills with clients for approval.
* The Catering Manager proactively pursues sales activities on weekly basis to align with achieving monthly budget, individual and team goals.
* Secures new accounts in the assigned market segment to contribute to enhancing, maximizing and maintaining a healthy portfolio of accounts.
* Ability to deal with internal and external customers, some of whom require high level of patience, tact and diplomacy identify need and appropriate catering and event accommodations.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with associates and customers.
* Ability to make sound business decisions and take action quickly based on previous experience and good judgment.
* Knowledge of hotel operations, including marketing plans, food and beverage, preparation of business plans, and sales management.
* The Catering Manager prepares weekly, monthly and quarterly and annual reports (i.e.: goals and forecasts on groups & events).
* Understands, maintains and demonstrates the five fundamental principles of: Sound Judgment, Integrity, Dependability, Connect, and Initiative.
* Completes additional duties as requested by Director of Sales.

**Job Requirements:**

**Competencies**

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

* Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; responds promptly to customer needs; solicits customer feedback to improve service; responds to requests for service and assistance; meets commitments.
* Communications - Expresses ideas and thoughts verbally; expresses ideas and thoughts in written form; exhibits good listening and comprehension; keeps others adequately informed; selects and uses appropriate communication methods.
* Managing Customer Focus - Promotes customer focus; establishes customer service standards; provides training in customer service delivery; monitors customer satisfaction; develops new approaches to meeting customer needs.
* Business Acumen - Understands business implications of decisions; displays orientation to profitability; demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; aligns work with strategic goals.
* Sales Skills - Achieves sales goals; overcomes objections with persuasion and persistence; initiates new contacts; maintains customer satisfaction; maintains records and promptly submits information.
* Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; plans for additional resources; sets goals and objectives; organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; develops realistic action plans.

**Education and/or Experience**  
Two years related experience and/or training in a hotel / resort sales environment; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

**Language Skills**  
Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.

**Reasoning Ability**  
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

**Computer Skills**  
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Database software. Delphi FDC, Opera PMS – Preferred , IHG Hotel Systems - Not required

**NOTICE:** 

**Friendwell Managed Hotels function twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week, 365 days a year. As a part of the hospitality industry a hospitable service atmosphere must be maintained at all times. All employees are required to project a friendly, welcoming, and positive attitude.** 

**Important Note:** The Position detailed in this Description is not limited to the functions listed. You may be required to perform additional reasonable duties according to business needs.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Ability to Commute:

* Elizabeth, NJ (Required)

title: Returns Processor
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a reliable and detail-oriented Processor to join our team. As a key member of our warehouse operations, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the efficient and accurate processing of orders for our e-commerce business. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, utilizing your skills for order returns

Responsibilities:

Overseeing the return and exchange processes for an online/in store retail environment. This role focuses on ensuring a seamless and efficient experience for customers returning products purchased through e-commerce channels. The specialist will handle all aspects of return processing, from customer inquiries to managing returned inventory, and work to resolve issues promptly while adhering to company policies. The ideal candidate will possess strong problem-solving skills, a customer-centric approach, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced e-commerce setting.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Return Processing:**
* **Handle Return Requests:** Process return and exchange requests from customers through various channels, including online portals, email, chat, and phone.
* **Inspect Returns:** Examine returned merchandise to ensure it meets the company’s return criteria, such as being in a resalable condition or within the return period.
* **Manage Refunds and Exchanges:** Facilitate the issuance of refunds, replacements, or exchanges in accordance with company policies.
* **Customer Interaction:**
* **Assist Customers:** Provide exceptional service by addressing customer inquiries and concerns related to returns and exchanges.
* **Communicate Policies:** Explain return policies and procedures to customers clearly and assist them with the return process.
* **Documentation and Reporting:**
* **Record Keeping:** Maintain accurate records of all return transactions, including reasons for returns and actions taken. All returns to be photographed and uploaded.
* **Generate Reports:** Create and analyze reports on return metrics, such as return rates, reasons, and costs, to identify trends and areas for improvement.
* **Inventory Management:**
* **Coordinate with Inventory Team:** Work with the inventory management team to ensure that returned items are properly processed, restocked, or disposed of.
* **Monitor Stock Levels:** Keep track of inventory levels and coordinate the handling of returned items to prevent stock discrepancies.
* **Policy and Procedure Adherence:**
* **Follow Company Policies:** Ensure compliance with the company's return policies and procedures.
* **Update Procedures:** Stay informed about updates to return policies and incorporate changes into daily operations.
* **Issue Resolution:**
* **Resolve Disputes:** Handle and resolve any issues or disputes related to returns, such as discrepancies or customer dissatisfaction.
* **Escalate Complex Issues:** Identify and escalate complex return issues to higher management when necessary.
* **Continuous Improvement:**
* **Suggest Improvements:** Identify opportunities to enhance the return process and customer experience.
* **Implement Changes:** Work with management to implement changes and improvements based on feedback and performance metrics.
* **Collaboration:**
* **Work with Teams:** Collaborate with customer service, quality control, and logistics teams to ensure efficient and effective return processing.
* **Provide Feedback:** Share insights and feedback with relevant departments to support overall operational improvements.
* **Customer Satisfaction:**
* **Enhance Experience:** Strive to provide a positive return experience for customers, aiming to resolve issues swiftly and professionally.
* **Follow-Up:** Conduct follow-ups with customers when necessary to ensure their satisfaction with the return process.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Experience:

* ERP systems: 3 years (Required)

Language:

* English (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Linden, NJ 07036 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Linden, NJ 07036: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: eDiscovery Data Technician / IT Technician (Hard Disk Imaging/PC Imaging)
description:
**Bring Your Own Device (BYOD)/Laptop**

**eDiscovery Data Technician**

**Notes:**

**This role will be 100% ONSITE**

* Will work in the eDiscovery Team
* Will work on Hard Drives (not programming), more hands on with the hardware, working with the actual equipment (ex - laptops, etc)
* Must have a technical mindset
* Experience in the Discovery field
* Experience with Computer Forensics
* Knowledge of cloning tools
* Will be doing some record keeping

**Possible titles/skills:**

* Hard disk Imaging
* PC Imaging

**Top Skills:**

* Must have computer hardware tools experience (eDiscovery, imaging, forensic, etc), AND being able to use software to manipulate what needs to be done on the equipment
* Must have at least 1.5 years of experience
* Bachelor's Degree would be preferred, with possible certifications

**Possible Software:**

* FTK Imager, Encase

**Candidate Profile:**

* High School Diploma or Equivalent with IT experience; (Bachelor's degree preferred)
* Full-time

**Overview**:

* The eDiscovery Data Technician is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and archiving information. Additional responsibilities will include facilitating data storage processes, creating detailed reports based on their work, and providing conclusions based on their observations.
* Advanced problem-solving skills are essential in this position to develop innovative solutions to data issues and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and multitask on separate projects with ease. In addition, they must work well together in a team setting with other data professionals and on their own with minimal supervision.
* The Data Technician provides services to Preserve Electronically Stored Information (ESI) for long-term storage. Following leadership's direction to prepare, conserve, and reproduce data.
* May also be responsible for managing data modifiers, troubleshooting, and initiating the resolution process.
* Data technicians also scan files, procure electronic records, and actively participate in business meetings to suggest ways to improve quality and productivity processes.
* The Data Technician will generally report their progress to the data supervisor in their department and work in an office environment.
* Close attention to detail is vital in this position to manipulate and classify data as it comes in, and the Data Technician must be proficient with computer software such as Office applications, databases, and forensic tools.

**Project Supported: Company Integration Project**

**Responsibilities**:

**The eDiscovery Data Technician’s primary responsibility is to fulfill the preservation request for Physical Disk Drives, Solid State Drives, and NVMe drives, which includes, but is not limited to the following:**

* Enter and verify data into standardized systems
* Organize and arrange files and data
* Search for, categorize, and enter data from multiple departments and sources
* Review documents and records for completeness and accuracy
* Compare records across fields and time to identify trends and quality problems
* Maintain detailed records for all requests, including the operations that were performed and the date and format of data delivery
* Utilize industry standard forensic hardware and software to ensure data integrity
* Active communication with and delivery of status updates to data supervisor
* Process all requests according to established intake processes and internal guidelines
* Perform other work-related duties as assigned

**Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma with tantamount IT experience for the position / Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required
* Industry related Technical Certifications preferred but not required
* Must have a minimum of 1.5 years of working experience in eDiscovery or Information Technology
* Strong technical skills
* Ability to exhibit & apply technical hardware knowledge with Workstations like Windows Laptops, Mac Laptops, and Towers
* Strong teamwork and communication/information sharing skills
* Exercise judgment and influence on key process and technical decisions (for example, policy, standards, technical solutions)
* Good organization, planning, and time management skills
* Demonstrated ability to manage complexity and handle/prioritize multiple tasks
* Process oriented
* Excellent written and verbal skills

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $28.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Hard disk Imaging: 3 years (Preferred)
* PC Imaging: 3 years (Preferred)
* Computer Forensics: 3 years (Preferred)
* Knowledge of cloning tools: 2 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Raritan, NJ 08869 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Activity Coach
description:
The Center’s mission is to help children and adults with differing abilities achieve their dreams. We do this by offering programs that support people with disabilities to live, work, learn and enjoy recreational opportunities in the community of their choice.

Our vision is to support people through teams that are dedicated to the achievement of excellence and innovation, embraced within a community based upon respect, kindness and open communication.

Center for Developmental Disabilities Values:

* Everyone is treated with dignity and respect.
* People are supported to reach their unique and maximum potential.
* Individual choices are encouraged and incorporated into everyday life.

At the Center, we embrace diverse voices and value the seen and unseen qualities that make each person unique. We are committed to the advocacy for people with disabilities through the creation of a community based upon full inclusion and equity. Our commitment to DEI learning facilitates opportunities and growth for our employees so that the people we support may thrive.

**This position receives a differential added to the base hourly rate, with the differential the pay rate for this position is $17.50 per hour to $18.25.**

**Some Job Responsibilities:**

title: Analyst/Compliance Investigator
description:
**Analyst/Compliance Investigator**
===================================

**Analyst/Compliance Investigator**
===================================

* **DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION**
* **Full-Time**
**Location****MANHATTAN**
* **Exam May Be Required**
**Department**
**Acco Office**
**Salary Range:****$65,574.00 – $100,000.00****Job Description**
-------------------


DOT is seeking a procurement professional to serve as Procurement Analyst 3 in the Agency Chief Contracting Officer's (ACCO) Office. Manage the contractors’ compliance and the goals for contracts with various funding sources (City, State, Federal), enforcing Procurement Policy Board (PPB) rules, and ensuring compliance with specifications and other rules and regulations. Monitor and oversee the implementation of Minority and Women-Owned Business Enterprise (M/WBE) and Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (DBE) programs on DOT contracts, to ensure those subcontractors committed by prime contractors in response to a contract goal are factually used and performing useful functions on projects funded through various sources. Monitor additional contracts that are based on grant agreements with various federal or other city agencies, confirming compliance with specific rules and regulations of various grantors and recommending solutions when issues appear. Review and analyze contractors' and subcontractors' documents to ensure conformity with the specifics and the requirements of contracts, and compliance with PPB rules, and City, State, and Federal rules. Communicate with all stakeholders on procurement related matters, draft memos and prepare summary reports with findings. Utilize various Citywide and agency systems to perform the tasks. Conduct field visits to interview contractors and subcontractors for compliance, including nighttime shift work. Collect and review information during audits, to ensure agency meets audit requirement consistent with 2CRF200. Attend bid openings and meetings with contractors for guidance on compliance issues. Utilize reliable research systems to provide critical information to various sources of inquiry (auditor, Department of Investigation, Small Business Services, and others). Perform other tasks equivalent to the Procurement Analyst 3 title.  

  

\\*\\*\\*TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION, CANDIDATE MUST BE SERVING PERMANENTLY IN THE TITLE OF PROCUREMENT ANALYST, OR HAVE FILED FOR PROCUREMENT
  

ANALYST CIVIL SERVICE EXAM# 1194, AND BE REACHABLE ONCE LIST IS ESTABLISHED OR, BE ELIGIBLE UNDER THE 55-A PROGRAM \\*\\*\\*

 **Minimum Qualifications**

  

1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and six months of satisfactory full-time professional experience in procurement of goods, services, construction or construction-related services, or professional, technical or administrative experience in contract negotiation/management; or
  

2. An associate degree or completion of 60 semester credits from an accredited college, and 18 months of satisfactory, full-time professional experience as described in “1” above; or
  

3. A four-year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and two and one-half years of satisfactory full time professional experience as described in “1” above; or
  

4. A combination of education and/or experience equivalent to “1”, “2”, or “3” above. College education may be substituted for professional experience under “2” or “3” above at the rate of 30 semester credits from an accredited college for 6 months of experience. However, all candidates must have at least a four year high school diploma or its educational equivalent and 6 months of the experience described in “1” above.
  

SPECIAL NOTES:
  

To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level II, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, either one year served at Assignment Level I or one additional year of the experience described in "1" above.
  

To be eligible for placement in Assignment Level III, individuals must have, after meeting the minimum requirements, either one year served at Assignment Level II or two additional years of the experience described in "1" above, at least one year of which must have been supervisory, or spent performing professional procurement duties equivalent to those performed at Assignment Level III.

 **Preferred Skills**

  

Knowledge of contract compliance procedures, and applicable rules and regulations, in public sector. Ability to communicate effectively in verbal and written form. A driver’s license valid in the State of New York, and the ability to drive DOT vehicle. This license must be maintained during the duration of employment in DOT. Willingness to work flexible hours (including nighttime when assigned) is preferred.  

**55a Program**

  

This position is also open to qualified persons with a disability who are eligible for the 55-a Program. Please indicate at the top of your resume and cover letter that you would like to be considered for the position through the 55-a Program.  

**Public Service Loan Forgiveness**

  

As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Education’s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/.  

**Residency Requirement**

  

New York City residency is generally required within 90 days of appointment. However, City Employees in certain titles who have worked for the City for 2 continuous years may also be eligible to reside in Nassau, Suffolk, Putnam, Westchester, Rockland, or Orange County. To determine if the residency requirement applies to you, please discuss with the agency representative at the time of interview.  

**Additional Information**

  

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.

title: Store Manager
description:
Off-White is a new form of luxury brand. Construction and deconstruction go hand in hand, recombining the codes of fashion, design, communication, art and technology. Well thought, well designed and well executed products are aesthetic as well as ethical statements with a contemporary cultural edge. Progress, innovation and diversity. We have taken the notion and development of a fashion brand to a new level altogether. Based in Milan, our creative office absorbs and transforms the heritage of Italian craftsmanship from a contemporary, global perspective on design and trends.

Off-White has been expanding its network of directly operated stores landing in the most prominent luxury retail venues across Europe and the United States. We are leveraging the power of physical points of sale to acquire new customers and foster brand loyalty.

**THE ROLE**

Off White is looking for a Store Manager for its store in Mercer St., New York City. You will report directly to the Retail Area Manager, US.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO**

* Lead a high performing customer service oriented team. Coach and provide feedback as necessary to ensure all customers are given the full Customer Experience in line with brand strategies.
* Set performance targets and drive department productivity and profitability (e.g. conversion rates, sales, UPT, AUR and customer data capture).
* Plan your Store schedule in accordance with peak business hours, ensuring customer traffic and demand can be met with the right employees at the right time.
* Demonstrate knowledge of the luxury retail market and current fashion trends.
* Be aware of current advertising and marketing campaigns, new product launches and promotions and ensure this is communicated to your team
* Embrace brand messages and cascade company communications to all members of your team.

**WHO YOU ARE**

* Excellent leadership and people management skills
* Experience in recruiting, training, and assessing talent
* Previous experience in luxury store management roles (3-4 years in a managerial role)
* Proven ability to increase sales and profitability
* Experience driving and maintaining customer service standards
* Demonstrate sound commercial and brand awareness
* Advanced knowledge of POS, store systems and comfortable using digital tools

**REWARDS & BENEFITS**

* Great compensation package (in consideration of your professional experience)
* Monthly sales commissions based on the store target
* Uniform and clothing allowance
* Store discounts according with the company policy
* Health insurance

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT**

Off-White is committed to being an inclusive workplace where diversity in all its forms is celebrated. We make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, colour, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances. If you require special accommodation, please let us know.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person

title: Home Health Aide Supervisor
description:
At RVNAhealth, you can experience satisfying and challenging work that makes a real difference in people’s lives, *every day*. We are an agency where you can feel valued and achieve professional growth and development with personal fulfillment.  

  

**Why RVNAhealth?**  

RVNAhealth (formerly known as RVNA, the Ridgefield Visiting Nurse Association) is an twelve-time winner of the Hearst Media Top Workplaces Award. We offer rewarding career opportunities where you can make an enormous impact*.*
  

  

**Benefits of Working at RVNAhealth**  

RVNAhealth is committed to providing an exceptional, supportive, and progressive work environment for each employee. We offer:  

* Competitive compensation
* Extensive benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, a 403(b) plan with matching contributions, life and disability insurance plans
* Paid time off
* Personal Wellness Days
* Mileage Reimbursement
* A supportive and employee-centric culture
* Comprehensive orientation
* Career path
* Ongoing educational, training and certification opportunities
* Wellness programs
* Work-life balance

The HHA Supervisor is a professional member of the StayingWELL team who provides assessment visits in clients’ homes, develops appropriate plan of care for clients based on individual needs, and provides supervision for Aides as needed/required by Agency policy and/or state/federal regulations. Our HHA Supervisor has a unique opportunity to ensure all patients are receiving the best possible care from our caregivers.  

  

**General Responsibilities:**  

* Meet with new clients as appropriate to review agreement and establish care plan
* Review and update care plans as needed (at least every 3 months) based on client change of conditions and/or needs
* Determine and communicate with Client Services Coordinators the skills/criteria necessary to ensure a positive Client/Caregiver match
* Communicate changes in care plans/client needs with clients and/or family members
* Receives and acts to resolve complaints made by patients/families regarding care or services received.
* Identify and manage high risk clients, refer to home health and hospice as needed
* Provide exceptional customer service to both clients and caregiver staff by responding to issues and/or requests in a timely, professional manner
* Actively develops and pursues referral sources, as well as facilitates on-going relationships with various ALF’s
* Covers for other HHA Supervisors in their absence
* Perform other duties as requested by Director
* Knowledge of RVNAhealth’s programs and services; makes referrals when needed to other service lines

  

**Management Responsibilities:**  

* Provide new hire orientation and competency testing on a rotational basis
* Assess and update orientation agenda as needed per changing regulations and/or RVNAhealth policies
* Provide and/or assist with monthly aide in-services/continuing education programs
* Provide in person or phone orientation to caregivers on first time visit with clients
* Carry out disciplinary action for caregivers as needed
* Provide routine supervision of aide staff in clients’ homes

  

**Qualifications:**  

* Current RN/LPN license in the State of Connecticut preferred
* Private Duty: 1 year preferred
* Management Experience
* Must have reliable transportation
* Must be organized and detail oriented
* Able to communicate clearly with patients, families, visitors, leadership and others.
* Able to teach patients and families in accordance with the nursing plan of care.
* Knowledgeable about reimbursement sources, Medicare regulations, licensing laws, and accreditation standards
* Competent computer skills
* Current CPR certification
* Must be able to travel to, enter and function in the homes/facility of any patient to assess and provide care to all patients

  

***RVNAhealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. RVNAhealth is committed to building a workplace where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized.***  

  

*This agency is independently owned and operated. Your application will go directly to the agency, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this agency. All inquiries about employment at this agency should be made directly to the agency location and not to the Connecticut Association for Healthcare at Home.*

title: Customer Service and Logistics Support in High End Furniture Showroom
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Employee discounts
* Paid time off
* Training & development

  

We are looking for a Customer Service Representative and Logistics Support to help run our client's post-sale needs efficiently and according to deadlines. The primary responsibility of this role includes managing customer post-sale inquiries via calls and email, which range from simple to complex, across a wide spectrum of topics, as well as processing payments and providing order status updates and shipment confirmations. Customer Service Representatives must excel at cross-functional collaboration, both internally and externally with business partners, to ensure that customer orders are accurately fulfilled and customer issues are resolved promptly and appropriately.  

  

Ultimately, you will ensure our customers receive the right orders on time, that invoices are paid, resolve any concerns, and provide excellent customer service. Maintain shipment records in digital databases, be highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to communicate and manage the flow of incoming and outgoing goods with minimal supervision.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

* Request shipping quotes and confirm quotes with customers
* Plan shipments based on sales, product availability, and customer requests
* Track orders to ensure timely deliveries
* Preparing and maintaining shipment paperwork, records, and digital databases.
* Keep track of incoming and outgoing orders
* Liaising with vendors and carrier services to coordinate logistics and timelines
* Assisting customers with scheduling, order status, and resolving shipment issues and complaints.
* Communicate delivery requirements for efficient management of our drivers and warehouse staff
* Oversee the levels of office supplies and stock and place orders as needed
* Keep track of shipping estimates and expenses

**Requirements and skills**  

* Must have 1-3 years experience in a logistics role (not Fedex and UPS)
* High school diploma or GED with at least three years of experience in retail customer service role and management of incoming and outgoing of goods, or similar.
* Italian speaking a plus
* Basic accounting knowledge
* Excellent organizational and time-management skills
* Proficiency in IOS and database management.
* Knowledge of inventory management and logistics elements.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Customer service skills
* Good communication skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and time-sensitive environment
* Attention to detail is essential
* You have to love moving pieces, data management, and getting things done.

ABOUT THE COMPANY  

Cosulich Interiors & Antiques is a small family-run business in retail one-of-a-kind vintage and contemporary Italian home furnishings (Lighting, Furniture, Decor, and Art) based in New York, NY. We are a fast-paced, on-demand, customer-centric, and collaborative environment.  

  

Our goal is to offer interior designers and architectural professionals unique artistic pieces as well as a customizable line, by collaborating with various artisans in Italy and focusing on the highest level of craftsmanship and tradition with a very personalized stellar customer service.  

  

Our work environment is an open space office showroom open to the public.  

  

WEBSITE: Cosulichinteriors.com

title: Dispensing Audiologist
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Company parties
* Competitive salary
* Dental insurance
* Free uniforms
* Health insurance
* Opportunity for advancement
* Paid time off

Brooklyn Audiology Associates is looking for a private practice Audiologist with a passion for delivering exceptional hearing healthcare and tinnitus treatment in a collaborative, supportive and forward-thinking environment. Our ideal candidate is an empathetic and compassionate provider who continuously challenges the status quo in everything they do.  

  

At BAA, we foster a positive work environment that ensures the success, growth and career satisfaction for all employees.  

  

We are open to a full-time or part-time Audiologist in any of our 3 Brooklyn-based offices – Bay Ridge, Brooklyn Heights and/or Sheepshead Bay.  

  

Apply today to start changing lives as a Brooklyn Audiology Associates Audiologist!  

  

**What you’ll do:**  

* Perform comprehensive audiological evaluations
* Administer cognitive screenings
* Extensive patient counseling
* Fit premium hearing technology (including Lyric invisible extended wear devices) to treat patients suffering from hearing loss and/or tinnitus
* Perform cerumen management
* Take earmold impressions/Otoscans (3D images of the ear canal)
* Perform virtual consultations
* Troubleshoot hearing device related issues
* Mentor Audiology doctoral students
* Provide aural rehabilitation

  

**Who you are:**  

* Doctor of Audiology (Au.D) or Master of Audiology (M.A.) from an accredited program
* Licensed to practice in New York State
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to make patients feel comfortable
* Passionate about learning and improving your skills to provide high quality care
* Team-player with a positive attitude who thrives in a collaborative environment
* Innovative, proactive and business-minded

  

**Who we are:**  

At Brooklyn Audiology Associates, we’ve been helping patients with their hearing loss, tinnitus, and hearing-related conditions since 1980. What sets us apart is our commitment to putting our patients first, providing exceptional hearing healthcare, our extensive 40 years of experience, and our compassionate approach in providing high-quality hearing rehabilitation.  

  

Our goal at Brooklyn Audiology Associates is to improve the lives of our patients and help preserve the hearing and brain health of our patients. We aim to help our patients better engage and interact with their friends and loved ones through education and medical treatment of their hearing loss and tinnitus.  

  

We have 3 locations in Brooklyn: Bay Ridge, Brooklyn Heights, and Sheepshead Bay – each location experiencing tremendous growth!  

  

**Benefits:**  

* Competitive salary plus commission
* Unlimited growth opportunity
* PTO (paid time off)
* Paid holidays
* Retirement savings plan with a company match
* Health, vision and dental insurance
* Licensure/professional membership fee reimbursement
* Help provide continuing education
* Sponsored work-related trips

title: Residential Supervisor Children's Residence
description:
The Center’s mission is to help children and adults with differing abilities achieve their dreams. We do this by offering programs that support people with disabilities to live, work, learn and enjoy recreational opportunities in the community of their choice.

Our vision is to support people through teams that are dedicated to the achievement of excellence and innovation, embraced within a community based upon respect, kindness and open communication.

Center for Developmental Disabilities Values:

* Everyone is treated with dignity and respect.
* People are supported to reach their unique and maximum potential.
* Individual choices are encouraged and incorporated into everyday life.

At the Center, we embrace diverse voices and value the seen and unseen qualities that make each person unique. We are committed to the advocacy for people with disabilities through the creation of a community based upon full inclusion and equity. Our commitment to DEI learning facilitates opportunities and growth for our employees so that the people we support may thrive.

**Some Job Responsibilities:**

* It is the responsibility of the RS to ensure that all individuals at their site receive support that is consistent with Support with Dignity and the Core Competencies.
* It is the responsibility of the RS to ensure that all staff at their site are thoroughly trained.
* It is the responsibility of the RS to effectively communicate and collaborate within their department as well as with other departments to achieve mutual goals.
* It is the responsibility of the RS to ensure that the interior and exterior (including vehicles) of the site are clean, tidy and well maintained.
* It is the responsibility of the RS to effectively plan, manage and monitor individual programming and treatment.

**Job Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma/GED
* Two years’ experience working with individuals with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities.
* Complete and maintain AMAP and SCIP certification, as per the Center's policy.

* Must be able to sit, stand, lift 50 lbs.

title: Commercial Morgage Servicing Analyst
description:
**G.S Wilcox & Co. Overview**

Founded in 1994 by Gretchen Wilcox, G.S. Wilcox & Co. is a leader in the commercial real estate mortgage banking industry. The firm provides debt and equity solutions to developers, real estate private equity firms, institutional investors, and other owners of commercial real estate. Representing 19 life insurance companies on a correspondent basis, the firm currently has a servicing portfolio of over $1.6 billion. G.S. Wilcox & Co’s mission is to add value to its clients by providing exceptional financing terms, customer service, and support.

The firm is seeking a Commercial Mortgage Servicing Analyst to assist with the daily operations and payment processing of the commercial loan servicing department

**Loan Servicing Associate Responsibilities**

**Operational Support**

* Prepare daily bank account reconciliations and audit report review and perform month end closing procedures.
* Process monthly loan payments and prepare banking entries.
* Assure real estate tax and insurance payments are processed timely and escrow analysis is run at least annually.
* Prepare and send out monthly billing, annual escrow analysis and Borrower annual statements.
* Manage new loan onboarding and verification across the portfolio.
* Ensure financial information is entered accurately into the loan servicing system.
* Create dynamic reports to more effectively and efficiently perform loan servicing functions and identify new loan origination opportunities.
* Review or prepare procedures for each loan servicing task to ensure the most efficient and effective process.
* Cross-train on loan servicing functions and ensure the in-place servicing system is updated accordingly.
* Prepare loan event requests for submission to the firm’s lenders to include loan document review, financial analysis and recommendation.

**Compliance Enforcement**

* Verify monthly, quarterly, and annual lender certifications regarding taxes, reserves and payments to ensure accurate and timely submission to lenders.
* Respond timely to audit confirmations for borrowers and lenders.
* Assist with the annual USAP loan servicing audit.

**Successful candidates should have the following qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in finance or accounting preferred, but not required.
* 2-3 years of commercial mortgage loan servicing experience.
* Excellent communication/organizational skills, a detail-oriented mentality, and strong time management skills.
* Possess a strong working knowledge of loan servicing software and Microsoft Office Suite, with attention to Excel, Microsoft Query and Power Query.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Experience:

* Mortgage servicing: 3 years (Preferred)
* Microsoft Office: 3 years (Required)
* Organizational skills: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Morristown, NJ 07960: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Sales Assistant
description:
**Sales Assistant**

Chery Equipment Group

Garden City, New York, United States (On-site)

**Company Details:**

Chery Equipment Group is a US distributor of globally recognized heavy equipment and industrial product.

We are a growing and dynamic company with two distinct business divisions: Chery Forklift, specializing in the sales and rental of heavy equipment and tools, and Chery Industrial, offering a wide range of industrial products.

Chery Equipment Group is looking for a candidate with business thought and data analysis capabilities. The Sales Assistant will help the Sales Director handle various related daily affairs which include developing new business and analyze sales data.

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Use software (such as *Excel, ERP, WMS*) to collect, record, and organize various sales data
* Use statical analysis to make reports
* Assist the Sales Director to develop new business
* Continuously track sales orders and resolve related matters as required
* Coordinate with our Logistics Department about incoming shipments
* Handling office related affairs.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree, Master’s degree is preferred
* Proficient in the use of office software, such as Microsoft Suite, Google Suite
* Experience in ERP, WMS, and Salesforce (preferred)
* Strong communication and writing skills

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
**Note:** This position requires a cover letter for consideration. Refer to the “How to Apply” section of the job description for details. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered.

**POSITION OVERVIEW**

The Retail Associate will be responsible for daily operations of the 9/11 Memorial & Museum store, carts (outdoors) and pop up shops- providing a safe, informative, and meaningful visitor experience.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

* Accurately handles cash, processing of credit cards and follows all financial policies.
* Arrives to work on time and work scheduled shifts.
* Must be able to work weekends (both Saturday and Sunday) and a flexible work schedule including mornings and evening shifts.
* Adheres to uniform & cell phone guidelines for all locations.
* Maintains a professional, safe and secure environment for guests and staff.

**OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Provides an enriching and excellent guest experience to all guests
* Be attentive to guests needs and aware of surroundings when on the sales floor.
* Upsells current promotions and ask for donations using proper verbiage when on register.
* Shares product stories when interacting with guests to educate them.
* Remains mobile, interact with guests and stay productive.
* Assists with physical inventory and cycle counts throughout the year.
* Assists with accurately processing of incoming deliveries, unpacking, counting and replenishment.
* Receiving goods shipped against P.O. and ensures that receiving reports are clear and accurate.
* Communicates discrepancies found when processing deliveries, prior to items placed on the sales floor.
* Confirms that products are represented in a compelling way that is consistent with visual guidelines.
* Assures Loss Prevention awareness to protect the store from internal and external shortage.
* Maintains all work areas, lockers, back office, stock room, clean and organized, free of empty boxes and trash.
* Accurately operates the POS system and its functions, including ringing up items correctly.
* Ensures accuracy when handling cash to avoid overages and shortages
* Communicates timely any POS errors that came up during a transaction.
* Ensures proper care of all 9/11 museum store property; ipads, iphones, walkies, scanners, donation boxes…etc.
* Required to work both indoor and outdoor locations.
* Adheres to company policies and procedures, standards and practices, regulatory compliance, and company directives including dress code and attendance.
* Follows request time off and blackout guidelines.

**MISSION EXPECTATIONS**

VOLUNTEER REQUIREMENT

* Participates in the Annual 5K Fundraiser and 9/11 Commemoration, as assigned.
* Assists with other special projects and events in support of all 9/11 Memorial and Museum, as assigned.

**QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS REQUIREMENTS**

* HS diploma/GED and minimum of 3 years’ experience in retail store sales
* Excellent customer/guest service skills
* Visual display skills a plus
* Proven cash handling skills
* Highly responsible, reliable and accurate individual
* Proven ability to have a take charge initiative
* Takes pride and ownership in the position and property (behavior not skill)
* Ability to work both as part of a productive team and independently
* Must be familiar with POS systems
* Fluency in one language other than English a plus

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT**

The physical demands and work environment described in this job description are representative of those that the employee will encounter and are expected to meet to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to see, be mobile, and have the ability for 2-way communication with the public and staff. The employee will be required to stand for long hours and be able to lift heavy boxes up to 40 lbs.

The work environment is both indoor and outdoor. The noise level in the retail environment is usually low. There are no protective devices to be worn or utilized in the retail work environment.

Work Remotely

* No

**HOW TO APPLY**

* Please submit a cover letter and resume to.
* Please include the job title and first and last name in the email subject
* Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States

**Note:** This position requires a cover letter for consideration. Refer to the “How to Apply” section of the job description for details. Applications without a cover letter will not be considered.

The National September 11 Memorial and Museum (9/11 Memorial & Museum) is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants who meet the qualification requirements of the role will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

The National September 11 Memorial & Museum (9/11 Memorial & Museum) is committed to an organizational culture that supports and reinforces our values regarding diversity, equity, inclusion, and accessibility (DEIA). We seek to build a collaborative, open, and equitable space where staff want to be, knowing that their contributions, professional expertise, and distinct voices are valued and respected. We encourage and celebrate an inclusive environment where candor and participation, when it comes to sharing ideas and collaborative problem-solving, are welcomed regardless of one’s role at the Museum or background.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to qualified candidates, during the interview process, to enable individuals with disabilities an opportunity to interview.

title: Delegate Account Executive
description:
**Delegate Account Executive**

RTM Business Group

Hybrid in NY, NJ, CT or Remote in CA, FL, TX, PA, GA, OH, IN, SC

Office Location: Midtown Manhattan, New York City

Full-time

51-200 employees · Market Research

Originally posted September 2024; this is a 100% hybrid or remote, full-time role

**Who We Are**

RTM Business Group is a professional development conferences and events company working in EdTech, Healthcare, Government, Medical and Banking sectors. We partner with Fortune 1000 companies, catering specifically to the C-suite, providing curated content and peer-to-peer collaboration.

Our events are located in major cities throughout the country – LA, Austin, San Diego, Miami, Chicago, DC, etc.. Our team travels together which is a truly unique experience, different from “traditional” work travel, which in turn cultivates interdepartmental relationships and friendships that drive our collaborative culture.

**About the Role**

RTM is looking for an ambitious Delegate Account Executive to join our team! The ideal candidate is excited by the opportunity to build relationships with C-Level and other senior executives, detail-oriented and passionate about professional development/growth. Your primary responsibility is gathering executives for our events through email marketing, social selling, calls, and pitches. We offer extensive, ongoing training and a unique opportunity for both collaborative and independent work.

Our events are located in major cities throughout the country – LA, Austin, San Diego, Miami, Chicago, DC, etc.. Our team travels together which is a truly unique experience, different from “traditional” work travel, which in turn cultivates interdepartmental relationships and friendships that drive our collaborative culture.

This role is Hybrid/Remote in NY, NJ and CT with 2 days a week in the office or remote in FL, TX, PA, GA, OH, SC and IN.

**Requirements**

* Heavy focus on email marketing; social selling, mainly through LinkedIn; phone calls and selling directly to C-Level and other senior executives
* Discover pain points and identify how our programs can help, with the goal of generating attendees for our conferences
* Act as a primary point of contact to the executives for questions, scheduling, the event itself and everything in between
* Travel nationally throughout the year for up to 6 events, 4-5 days per event
* Create, monitor and manage tasks on our CRM, Airtable
* Work collaboratively with internal teams to produce event collateral, materials and follow-up
* Build and maintain relationships with a diverse network of individuals and organizations

**Skills and Qualifications**

* 6 months - 2 years of experience in a similar role, B2B experience preferred
* Ability to travel
* Bachelor's degree
* Professional & interpersonal communication skills
* Passion for professional learning and development
* Self-starter, extremely organized and detailed-oriented with a strong commitment to accuracy
* Must be proactive and have the ability to work under pressure
* Balance and prioritize multiple deadlines at once
* Exceptional follow-up and follow-through skills
* Competency with technology and ability to learn new software and applications

*Preferred Qualifications*

* Experience with Airtable
* Background in Sales, Marketing, Customer Success or B2B events

**Benefits**

* 15+ PTO Days
* Flexible/Hybrid work model (WFH and Remote opportunities)
* Medical/dental/vision coverage
* 401K after 12 months of employment
* Pre-tax commuter benefits
* Travel to major cities (all expenses paid)
* Opportunity for lateral and vertical movement within the company, inter/intra departmentally

Salary $40,000 - $50,000 base + bonuses/incentives/uncapped commission

Year one total compensation expectations: $55,000 - $70,000

title: Apparel Quality Assurance/Compliance Specialist
description:
We are seeking a meticulous and organized **Apparel Quality Assurance/Compliance Specialist** to ensure the highest standards of product quality and regulatory compliance. The ideal candidate for the **Apparel Quality Assurance/Compliance Specialist** will have experience with product care and content labeling, packaging compliance, and factory audits, as well as familiarity with Walmart and Costco testing labs and sustainability portals.

***Key Responsibilities for Apparel Quality Assurance / Compliance Specialist:***

**Product Care and Content Labeling:**

* Prepare and review product care labels and content to ensure accuracy and compliance with regulatory standards.
* Ensure all product labeling meets industry and company-specific guidelines.

**Packaging Compliance:**

* Review product packaging for compliance with relevant regulations and standards.
* Coordinate with packaging teams to ensure that all packaging materials and designs adhere to compliance requirements.

**Factory Audits and Follow-Up:**

* Conduct factory audits and follow up on corrective actions.
* Review and file audit reports, ensuring all findings are addressed.

**Testing Reports and Tracking:**

* Track and maintain all testing reports and documentation.
* Ensure timely and accurate filing of all testing reports.

**Fabric and Garment Pull Testing:**

* Follow up with factories and QA teams on fabric and garment pull testing.
* Prepare and submit testing request forms.

**Garment Inspection Coordination:**

* Coordinate with factories for garment inspection bookings.
* Track and monitor garment inspections in collaboration with the QA team in China.
* Follow up on the filing of inspection reports and ensure all documentation is completed.

**Supply Chain and Compliance Certifications:**

* Monitor and track supply chain activities and factory compliance.
* Follow up on compliance certifications and ensure all documentation is up-to-date.

**Sustainability Reporting:**

* Work with factories to compile information for yearly sustainability reporting.
* Utilize Walmart Sustainability Portal and TSC for reporting and compliance purposes.

**Required Skills and Qualifications for Apparel Quality Assurance/Compliance Specialist:**

* **Previous experience with Walmart and Costco testing labs is preferred.**
* Familiarity with Walmart Sustainability Portal and TSC is an advantage.
* **Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word.**
* Experience with PLM (Product Lifecycle Management) systems.
* Knowledge of A2000 software is a plus.
* **Strong organizational and time management skills.**
* Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
* Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
* This role is in the NYO Daily

title: Floating Medical Counselor/DSP
description:
The Center’s mission is to help children and adults with differing abilities achieve their dreams. We do this by offering programs that support people with disabilities to live, work, learn and enjoy recreational opportunities in the community of their choice.

Our vision is to support people through teams that are dedicated to the achievement of excellence and innovation, embraced within a community based upon respect, kindness and open communication.

Center for Developmental Disabilities Values:

* Everyone is treated with dignity and respect.
* People are supported to reach their unique and maximum potential.
* Individual choices are encouraged and incorporated into everyday life.

At the Center, we embrace diverse voices and value the seen and unseen qualities that make each person unique. We are committed to the advocacy for people with disabilities through the creation of a community based upon full inclusion and equity. Our commitment to DEI learning facilitates opportunities and growth for our employees so that the people we support may thrive.

**This position has a differential added to the base hourly rate, with the differential added the hourly salary range is $18.50 per hour to $23.10 per hour.**

**Some Job Responsibilities:**

* It is the responsibility of the Medical Counselor to ensure that the individuals at their site receive support that is consistent with Support with Dignity and the Core Competencies.
* It is the responsibility of the Medical Counselor to advocate for those they support.
* It is the responsibility of the Medical Counselor to participate in trainings that will help them better understand and support the individuals they work with.
* It is the responsibility of the Medical Counselor to work with the residential nurse and management team to ensure the best support for individuals and to achieve mutual goals. The Medical Counselor is expected to demonstrate initiative and follow-through with assigned responsibilities.

**Job Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma/GED
* Complete and maintain AMAP and SCIP certification, as per the Center's policy.
* Valid NYS Driver’s License.
* Must be able to sit, stand, lift 50 lbs.

We are seeking experienced caregivers to become a part of our team! We offer a supportive work environment as well as a flexible work schedule!

We host an open house every Wednesday from 10:00 am – 2:00 pm, no appointment is necessary!

Our office is at 153 Main Street, Suite 1. We are a single-standing white building wedged between Dunkin Donuts and Chase Bank. There is parking on Main Street, or you can park behind the Chase Bank.

title: DAL-TILE CLASS B DELIVERY DRIVER
description:
**Job Description:**  

* Local Class B Deliver Driver (Home Daily)
* Forklift and Warehouse Duties as Assinged
* Mon - Fri; 6:30am-Finished

  

**Job Requirements:**  

* Be at least 23 years old
* Possess a Class B commercial driver’s license (CDL)
* Have a minimum of 6 months commercial driving experience
* Have good interpersonal communication and customer-service skills
* Be able to maneuver heavy products using forklifts and pallet jacks
* Be willing to work a flexible schedule

  

***Find your future with Mohawk Industries.***  

Since 1947, Dal-Tile has offered its residential and commercial customers the industry’s broadest array of tile and stone products. Dal-Tile is a part of Mohawk Industries, a Fortune 500 multinational flooring company that employs 24,000 people throughout North America, including a private fleet of drivers who deliver our products. Drivers who join Mohawk often stay until retirement because we offer great pay and benefits, consistent work schedules and predictable home time.  

**Dal-Tile Delivery Drivers** assist with operations inside warehouses and distribution centers, and deliver palletized hard-surface flooring products, stone and accessories to Dal-Tile Sales Service Centers, customers and job sites.  

**Why be a Dal-Tile Delivery Driver?**  

* Professionally maintained, reliable and safe equipment
* Medical, dental and vision benefits
* Paid vacation

  

**About Mohawk**  

Mohawk Industries has been a trusted name in carpets for more than 130 years and is a leading supplier of flooring, offering a complete selection of carpet, ceramic tile, laminate, wood, stone, vinyl, rugs and other home products. title: Automotive Repair Technician C
description:
***As an Automotive Technician Level C, AAA CLUB ALLIANCE can offer you:***

* **A VERY competitive compensation package that is the best in the industry!**
* **20 Billable Hour Guarantee Per Week**

***A Productivity Incentive that gives you the potential to earn up to an additional $1,100 per month!***

* **Our full-time technicians work a total of 5 days each week, with Mondays, Friday & Saturdays typically required. You’ll get Sundays off each week, and another day during the week off dependent on business need.**
* **Medical, Dental & Vision insurance, 30 days after you start!**

* **Paid Training and Paid ASE Certifications**
* **Technician Tool Insurance & Paid Uniforms**

***What our Automotive Technician Level C's do:***

* **Perform the following repairs: basic suspension and steering diagnosis and repair, basic brake diagnosis and repair, alignments, tire repair, oil changes, fluid maintenance exchange, and battery check and installation.**
* **Maintain knowledge of general automotive skills, and continue to develop additional technical skills, to enable flexibility in work assignments.**

**What you will need to succeed:**

* **High School Diploma or equivalent.**
* **Ability to accurately repair vehicles using standard automotive procedures at a level normally acquired through the completion of two (2) years as an automotive technician.**
* **Automotive Service Excellence (ASE) or car dealer certification in at least two categories: Suspension & Steering, and Brakes, or the equivalent knowledge and experience with the ability to attain the required certifications within 12 months of hire.**
* **Valid Driver's license**
* **Ability to lift a maximum of 75lbs, and stand for prolonged periods of time.**
* **The ability to complete satisfactory Pre-Employment Screenings (background check, drug screening, fitness for duty assessment) if offered the position.**
* **Authorized to work in the USA.**

We strive to attract and retain candidates with a passion for their work and we encourage all qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, gender, identity, veteran status, sexual orientation, physical ability or national origin, to apply.**
